responses.text: What's your take on the situation here?
Were could I find work around here?

dynamic_line.no: Oh, uh… you look new.  Didn't think we'd see new people here.  Hey.

responses.text: I'm just a traveler, kid.  I won't be staying here for long.
I'm not exactly new here, kid.
Hey, kid.  I can't stay to talk.

dynamic_line: I have a name, you know.  It's Jeremiah, but people just call me Jerry.

responses.text: Sorry, Jeremiah.  I'll be on my way.

dynamic_line: I thought asking about each other's emotions went out of style after <the_cataclysm>.  Uhm, okay then.  I'm fine, I guess.

responses.text: I noticed you're holding a D&D handbook.  Do you play much?
I've convinced Kostas to take you on.

dynamic_line: My take?  You already know how things are.  People are dead, my friends are dead, so yeah.  At least there's no school, the adults just love reminding me that.  You know what?  I kinda miss school.

I was in high school, like anyone else my age.  Then out of nowhere, my mom pulled me out of school to "save me".  I got packed into a bus with my parents and their old-timey friends.  We've been stuck here ever since.  Actually, it's not all that bad.  I'm studying to be a herbalist like Kostas, which is cool I guess.
Yeah, I play.  I ran a campaign for a while with some of my friends, we'd play after school.  I don't know where they are now, though.  Do you wanna play some?

responses.text: No thanks, I'd better get going.

dynamic_line: &Jeremiah leans his head towards your ear, speaking in a low whisper.  "To be honest with you, I don't like my mom at all.  She's like a <swear> helicopter, always telling me what to do, where to go, who I can be with.  She never thinks of me as an individual, only some idea of who she thinks I am.  My dad's alright, he's the chef around here."

dynamic_line.yes: I don't know, exactly.  I think I'll stay here and do what I can for the community.
dynamic_line.no: I'd like to study herbology with Kostas, it seems like a useful skill these days.  I do feel bad for Jane though, she's a skilled doctor and nobody here cares, they all just think any illness can be prayed away.

responses.text: When do you plan on starting that apprenticeship?

dynamic_line: Well…  Kostas is a bit unsure about teaching me, for some reason.  If you could change his mind, I'd pay you some "icons", what we've started using for money around here.

responses.text: No thanks.  Let's talk about something else.
I'll see what I can do for you.

dynamic_line: That's great!  Thanks <name_g>, here's the money.

Darryl should have something for you to do if you like gardening, Jane could use some medical supplies, too.  If you like to be bossed around, Helena probably has a few things that need doing.  I'd just ask around, really.
